summary: The "County of Dubrovnik-Neretva" is a designated administrative region within Croatia, classified under the category of 7211 regions of EU Member States. This region plays a crucial role in the EU's regulatory framework, particularly concerning regional development and cohesion policies. As a part of the European Union, Dubrovnik-Neretva is eligible for funding and support under various EU programs aimed at enhancing economic growth and sustainable development. The legal status of this county allows it to engage in cross-border cooperation initiatives, fostering collaboration with neighboring regions and contributing to the overall integration objectives of the EU.
